entry.title: å‹¿ä»¥æ©å°è€Œä¸æ„Ÿï¼Œå‹¿ä»¥èµ¢å°è€Œä¸éº»
entry.content:
0x01 å‰è¨€

å…¨å›½äººåˆçŸ¥é“äº†, å‰æ—çœåœ¨2022å¹´5æœˆ2æ—¥èµ·å¼€å§‹å¤§è§„æ¨¡é£æ•£å¤§å­¦ç”Ÿäº†ã€‚
æŠ±æ­‰ï¼Œæ‰“é”™å­—äº†ï¼Œå¤§å­¦ç‰²ã€‚
æœ¬æ–‡å†™äº08May, æ—¨åœ¨â€œæ„Ÿæ©â€æŸå®çœâ€œå…è´¹éš”ç¦»â€å‰æ—çœè¿”ä¹¡å¤§å­¦ç‰²çš„ç›¸å…³å†…å®¹ã€‚ğŸ¤¡

0x02 å…¨éƒ¨

ä»¥ä¸‹å†…å®¹å°†ä½¿ç”¨è¹©è„šè‹±è¯­æè¿°ã€‚
What the hell are they doing? I don't understand why they are so ridiculous!
According to the quarantine regulation they submitted to the Central, the quarantine policy of the whole Jilin should be like 0+0=FREE, while they actually didn't do that.
Thank you very much! You are so smart.
Why you don't understand what the statistics from JHU said!
All day around, you say the useless things like, according to the statistics so-called-announced by JHU - which they actually didn't do - many many US citizens confirmed COVID.
Yes, the statistics should be correct, but...
Can you tell me how the case-fatality rate is?
NO, THEY CAN'T!
But that's fine, either.
I really don't understand what?
In fact, I can stay in the country, from the mind.
But, one cannot limit my rights to go abroad, right?
I believe, Ryoken should be the identity document, so one must have the right to get one.
The heavy load, the ridiculous regulations.
Tomorrow should be better!
But maybe not for me.
